sample_questions: How do I create a monthly budget?
How can I track my expenses better?
How do I stick to a budget?

response_template.intro: Creating and following a budget is fundamental to achieving financial stability and reaching your financial goals.
budget_creation_steps: Calculate your total monthly income after taxes
List and categorize all your expenses (fixed and variable)
Track your spending for 1-2 months to understand your habits
Allocate funds to different categories based on your needs and goals
Review and adjust your budget regularly

budget_frameworks.50_30_20_rule: The 50/30/20 rule suggests allocating 50% of your income to needs (housing, food, utilities), 30% to wants (entertainment, dining out), and 20% to savings and debt repayment.
budget_frameworks.zero_based_budgeting: Zero-based budgeting assigns every dollar of your income a specific purpose, so your income minus expenses equals zero.
budget_frameworks.envelope_system: The envelope system involves placing cash for different expense categories in separate envelopes and only spending what's in each envelope.

tracking_methods.spreadsheets: Creating your own spreadsheet in Excel or Google Sheets
tracking_methods.traditional: Pen and paper tracking or using a budgeting journal

sticking_to_budget_tips: Build in some flexibility for unexpected expenses
response_template.conclusion: Remember that budgeting is a skill that improves with practice. Don't get discouraged if you don't get it perfect right away. The goal is progress, not perfection.
